website_summaries.verdict: Designed just for kids, this Echo Dot lets you stream music via Bluetooth, offers kid skills, explicit music filters, and other great Alexa features.
pros: Advanced Audio Distribution Profile (A2DP) support for audio streaming from your mobile device to Echo Dot Kids Edition
Besides being a speaker, this kid-friendly Alexa is a DJ, comedian, and storyteller
Includes one free year of FreeTime Unlimited, ad-free radio stations and playlists, Audible books, and a growing list of premium kids skills
Automatically filters explicit songs from Amazon Music

customer_reviews.title: Kids Editions plays Erotica!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a number of Alexa devices in our house and they work very well. We bought the Kids Edition for our 4-year old son. We told it "play bedtime thunderstorm" and instead it played erotica. See the attached screenshot showing it correctly understood the request. On a normal Alexa, this plays white noise. How they could they possibly build a Kids Edition that ignores the normal requests and instead plays erotica?? I contacted support who told me we should say "play bedtime stories". How is that the solution?
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: although it looks cool, it has many restrictions on regular features
customer_reviews.text: although it looks cool, it has many restrictions on regular features. My son wanted to hear Imagine Dragons music, kids dot refused to play. He wanted sleep sounds, kids dot refused to play. I also had previously gone through the parental settings, adjusted the age limit, and permitted all the skills and such, and still would not play. Returning and getting a regular dot instead.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hitzig

customer_reviews.title: Voice Routines do NOT work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kid based on the ads and articles that said you could do voice routines. I have set up many, many routines on our echo and echo dot. For the kids echo dot, it appears they do not work at all. I want my kid to say good morning alexa and have it turn on the lights (something it DOES do with the voice command), along with play a song and a message wishing him a good day. Despite ALL of these routines working on our echo, none work on the echo dot in his room.

customer_reviews.title: Great with a few kinda big flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really love these. Easy to use and set up. Seriously am glad I purchased. However the only reason not a five star is you have to be annoyingly specific to do certain things and with kids they get frustrated. Also when amazon explicit filter was turned on with amazon music it still played A LOT of inappropriate songs for young children. See picture.
customer_reviews.author: Allroundgamer

customer_reviews.title: Tears, tears, and utter betrayal!
customer_reviews.text: This frustrates my child more than anything else. She doesn't understand as much as the normal Alexa and it's harder to get her to do the things she should. For example, when we ask her to play songs that the normal Alexa could pull up right away, this one almost always plays the wrong song or the karaoke version. I have had several instances where my child was in tears because she felt that this Alexa didn't like her because she wouldn't do the right thing. She has been wittled down to an expensive timer that my child occasionally says good morning too.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Vargas

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT CONTROL SMART HOME DEVICES... aka what's the point of buying this at all?
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Dots Kids Edition doesn't allow my kids to control any smart devices in the house. On the website it says: "Control of compatible smart home devices will be enabled in a software update coming soon." How soon? Why wasn't this a feature when the product was sold? I'll change my review score when the update happens, if it happens, and an apology is given to everyone who bought this nonfunctional hardware. I wish I had paid less money for the regular Dot, or simply went with Google products instead.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Where are the feminine colors?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: Why all the boy colors? What about the girls that like pink, torquorise, purple???? For a child- the colors blue, red, and green are seen as ‘boy colors’. A little boy usually wouldn’t want anything in the color pink just as many little girls would avoid these colors. With these colors girls are forced to ‘settle’ for less then what they want, while boys have THREE OPTIONS. Feminine girls have NONE.Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not filter explicit songs.
customer_reviews.text: This does not filter explicit songs from Amazon music like advertised. Even with explicit filter on, Alexa played innapropriate music when they were asking to play music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of these for both of our kids with high hopes for great things WELL we got much less then we expected. The one reason we wanted the dot for our children's rooms was so that we could use the sleep sounds app for a sound machine at bedtime. Unfortunately that app is not an approved app for the kids edition. Their are no parental controls to override this feature and I've sent 3 supports requests to Amazon with no response. To make the situation even worse we were supposed to receive a FREE echo dot with our purchase which I still haven't recieved. Horrible product and customer service on Amazon's part.
customer_reviews.author: RCAustin

customer_reviews.title: I love Echo products
customer_reviews.text: I love Echo products. This was our 4th device in our house. We were thrilled to have a kids version. After trying for HOURS to set up a connection with our smart home devices, then another hour with tech support, I googled and found that the Echo Dot Kids now has in the description that Smart Home skills are not currently available. This would have been good to know before pre-ordering the device. But, as Amazon is amazing, they are returning it and gave me a credit for the hassle. Now, I'll apply that to a standard Echo Dot.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you already have a device for your kids
customer_reviews.text: So the product itself is fine - I just feel like I was tricked into buying another Echo Dot. I got an Echo Dot for my daughter at Christmas, but thought there was something unique about the Kids Edition. Turns out, you can just turn this feature on any device. The other piece that comes "free" is the Kids Time Unlimited, which we were already paying for. So basically I bought a very expensive Echo Dot with the sole benefit is it's colorful case.
customer_reviews.author: Magneto

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Good but would purchase the regular dot if I had to do it again. It does not filter out content well enough to make it worth it. Our 4 y.o.daughter has been able to get Alexa to play explicit songs while asking to play songs from the frozen songs. I would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W.

customer_reviews.title: dull
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great idea BUT I dont really care for this version. Its a pain in the rear. She doesnt know a lot of "stuff" and trying to find a book that my son can listen to that isnt read by Alexa seems darn near impossible. And of course I am 2 days past my return window. I guess Ill have to keep her for the weather forecast. The 2 stars is for the alarm wake up sounds. Super limited. I would loved to have the option for exchange. I would switch it out for a regular echo dot. Love and learn
customer_reviews.author: michelle s

customer_reviews.title: Seriously?!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the two pack and setting up two kid’s devices was a nightmare. Besides the app being so ridiculously taxing, we had to download a freetime app which is just as bad. Then, the app required that I setup the kid’s stuff on my fire HD! It took well over 1 hr just to set it up because the app hung so much. At this point, I am going to bed and don’t even know if it works properly! Then comes setting up an alarm for school....that’s another nightmare! It’s great for telling you what time it is, though!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted an iPod to listen to music, but I didn't want her to have earbuds in all the time and I wanted a little something more. This is perfect. She gets kids appropriate music and can play games, hear jokes and have stories read to her. We homeschool, so we can also use Alexa for school purposes (audio books, music, educational games). It's so amazing, I want one! It is a little tricky to set up, so I would recommend looking for YouTube videos about set-up, but there were plenty of those.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Milacek

customer_reviews.title: Agree with most reviews
customer_reviews.text: I'd have to agree with most reviews, this wasn't ready for showtime, the available books and music and are very difficult to figure out. Think about Prime video. When you search you can see clearly see what's available, and what's rent or buy. There are no lists or clear compilation of books in Free time. Also, the music! Sheesh people, just because a rap song is censored doesn't mean my 8 y/o needs to hear it! They found one song about big booties....ugh. I'm not too concerned about that necessarily it's just so pointless to what I'd like the device to be useful for. Also don't even get me started on the stupid Alexa app. Geez.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burks

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think we needed a kids edition until we had it running
customer_reviews.text: We love is new addition to the family! We have many Alexa units (various models) throughout our home but this model with the addition of Freetime was perfect for the kids bedroom. Or daughter interacts with Alexa quite a bit for music, lights and stories. Timers and the ability to do announcements (replaced our intercom) makes it a multitasker.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H

customer_reviews.title: Very good product like all of the Alexa's product line.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product like all of the Alexa's product line. I have nothing bad to say any of them. Liked the fact that it comes with a two year no questions warranty, and a year of the Free Time. I just wish they would of worked a little longer on the Alexa part. My granddaughter has a little bit of a speech impairment and so has trouble getting Alexa to understand her. Alexa's getting better at understanding her but, my granddaughter is still having trouble with her. If Amazon's people work a little more on the kids part of Alexa it would be a fantastic product that every home should have.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Endicott

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you plan on keeping FreeTime
customer_reviews.text: It works well as designed, but I do have one negative. You get a free year of free time, but it offers no way to set it up as a normal dot. What this means is it seems to lock you into having to renew freetime to use it after the year expires. My kids are 13 almost 14 so it doesn’t make sense to keep free time. The reason I ordered it over the regular dot was it was on sale for less than the dot, which I would expect a model that normally cost twice as much to at least be able to be set up as the cheaper model.
customer_reviews.author: TheooT

customer_reviews.title: Love the kids Dot
customer_reviews.text: My 6 1/2 yr. son became intrigued with my mother-in-laws Dot. He was constantly asking it to play music and tell jokes. Finally, she got him one for Christmas. We put it up in his room so he won't drive us crazy. I love that he can play music, games, have it read stories and set an alarm. He wakes up every morning and talks to it (sometimes for 45 min. on the weekend). It gives us an extra 45 min. sleep so I love that too! The only negative I can say so far is that there are a lot of stories he asks for that it will not read.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen L. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $80
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t do the things my daughter likes. Won’t play babbling Brooke. Doesn’t tell the Amazon bedtime stories. Hard to give commands to. No Disney stories. Waste of my $
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This product was not easy to set up. I am so upset as this was a birthday gift for my son. It was #1 on his list for what he wanted most for his birthday. He has had this now for about a month and a half and has only used it 3 times. Every time he asked "Alexa" to play music she didn't have anything to play. Most times Alexa said she didn't understand. This was really such a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Mama R

customer_reviews.title: Does not work consistently
customer_reviews.text: We previously had our Amazon Echo in our son's room for noise at night and music. We liked the features of the dot and the restrictions we could place on it. All of that has worked okay but it simply doesn't work consistently. We have to say the same instruction multiple times to get it to actually work. If we don't say something in a very strict way, then it doesn't work. We didnt have these issues with the Echo. I wouldn't recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Shand

customer_reviews.title: My kiddo loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my kids (mostly my daughter) because she is constantly using our Alexa. She LOVES her little "Alexa Draculaura Monster High"-- yes, that's what she named it. The only gripe I have is that she's constantly calling our kitchen (where our Alexa is) when she's right in the next room. She's happy, so I'm happy. We've had it read stories and we've had it play music, it wakes her up with her favorite songs. It's loud enough for little ears and I love that I can chime in when needing to tell her to get downstairs. It's a really cool little contraption for a little kid who asks a lot of "why" questions.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: A waste of $$
customer_reviews.text: I bought the kids version thinking I was being a responsible adult. What I learned is that the extra $$ was for the green casing around the dot. You get the first year of child "whatever" free and then have to pay annually. For all of this extra $$, you get a case and Alexa can only tell jokes and spell words. We enabled several functions including Disney but after spending an hour on the phone with Amazon and the Alexa people, we learned that we had to disable the child proof functions in order to get music, 20 questions, etc. In conclusion, don't buy the kids version! With the disabled function "to protect kids", it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Greer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.  And your time.
customer_reviews.text: After fighting with customer service for an hour i finally got them to let me return this. Didn’t work for us wouldn’t play pandora. Took forever to set up. And forget customer service for the dot (which is way different than the stellar amazon service you’re used to). They tried to force me to like it. And tried to force more support on us after an hour and all i wanted at that point was a return label for a kids echo dot. We have the original dot and love it. Amazon- get this dot and the customer service up to snuff.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Super frustrating for us!!!
customer_reviews.text: This echo dot is the 2nd one we have in ourhousehold, and this kids edition Alexa literally responds to everything you ask "I'm not sure about that." I have researched and been all thru the alexa app and even when I ask her something read directly from the app she does not know about that. So, my daughter has had this since Christmas and we both get so frustrated with her echo that it does not get used. Honestly cant even get her to play a song. Never had a problem with my echo dot 3rd generation, but this one is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G.

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to an iPad!
customer_reviews.text: Product is great for my 9 year old. He has found many interesting games and podcasts to make better use of his time than simply sitting in front of an iPad screen. That being said I have two major complaints: the first is that his “news briefing” (which is essentially a selected group of items Alexa can report on such as weather, s ores of recent professional games and news headlines) does not work despite authorizing certain materials in the patent dashboard. Second, despite this being the kid version I’ve heard my son be able to call up music genres with lyrics that are not “clean”.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica P

customer_reviews.title: Great and the kids love it but I had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great and the kids love it but I had to purchase a Kindle Fire in order to have the app, as my other products are not compatible. Yes, I could log into the parent dashboard online with my laptop, but I find that there are more controls and more choices in the app. I love the ability to control access at certain times. The advertisement for having lots of audiobooks for my children to listen to is a big disappointing. The selection is not as great as I'd hope it would be. Still overall, we like the product and are happy with it in general.
customer_reviews.author: C'est la vie

customer_reviews.title: Beyond perfect for the kids
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for our kids, for music in their bathroom, music in their playroom, but also to use as an intercom so we do not have to try and yell up two flights of stairs. They will tell the kids stories, play music and play games. Pros: comes with amazon FreeTime unlimited With freetime, we are able to monitor what they are requesting from the dot and what they are listening to. Comes with bumper to protect the dot. Con: with the bumper on, you can’t fit it into a wall holder but this is not much of a con.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Arsenault

customer_reviews.title: No way to “drop in” from Alexa app
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandchild so we could talk to her through the Alexa app on our phones, but it always says she is unavailable to drop in on no matter how many options we and her mother turn on. That’s very disappointing. Apparently she can turn her bedroom light on and off—big deal. It’s sad that I have to search the web for advice about the situation instead of having an Amazon source for advice and troubleshooting, because no one on earth seems to have the answers. You make it seem that it should just start working, but that is far from true.
customer_reviews.author: BarbaraP

customer_reviews.title: Has problems staying online
customer_reviews.text: Not so great we only had ot for a week and it came offline already and im having trouble setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Love the colors for echo!
customer_reviews.text: Had to have the colors! lol my little girl loves green so i got the green. The kids features was the selling point for me tho. my little one likes attention as most childen do. and we are not able to always give them the attention they want so here alexa can help a little bit. She loves all that it can do and loves to ask alexa questions. so far its a been an excellent addition to the house and the beginning of making our home smarter. well, now everyone in the house has been using it. i had to order more for the big ppl... they will arrive tomorrow lol
customer_reviews.author: Teagan Stensrud

customer_reviews.title: This product is absolutely terrible! The set up sucks and is impossible to ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely terrible! The set up sucks and is impossible to do. What a waste of time and energy. We are returning it for a regular echo. Super frustrating and super disappointed by such a bad roll out of a kids edition. My son was so excited to get this but he cannot do anything on it. Not matter how many times I try and add free time it doesn’t work . Save your money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Big Family Hit!
customer_reviews.text: So far, my kids and I love this. Set-up was a little interesting, I had to "click" off and then back on the Free Time setting in the Alexa App ( it was already enabled) to get it to activate, but after that, it was easy to register, set-up and install. The kids' version of Alexa is great. The speaker is not that of an Echo, but kids don't care and it sounds good. It's not bad in anyway. It's completely controllable and has a ton of parent offerings. I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra $
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my kids. One works okay but I can’t say the additional content is worth paying the extra for the kids edition. The second one stopped working after a day and is permanently stuck on “do not disturb”. I’ve tried deregistering and resetting it to no avail. The one star is due to the fact that though it has a two year warranty, they only provide a written address for queries on it, no phone number. Not worth my time when I can buy a regular version for $30.
customer_reviews.author: AL_KO

customer_reviews.title: If your child doesnt say words properly dont buy
customer_reviews.text: I have an autistic kiddo with some speech delays. If your child doesnt speak properly do not buy this. All I listen to is him screaming at Alexa because he will tell it to do one thing and it will do something not even close to what he asked for. Also, I have noticed when we are sitting in the living room together it will randomly start chiming like someone is listening in on our home. I usually unplug it until we need it. I own 2 because they had a b1g1 deal. I'm not quite sure it was a deal. I own a echo show which is much nicer than these. I wish I never ordered these.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Skip this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not kid or adult friendly! We can’t get it to play sleep sounds..! It just won’t work!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: DropIn needs fixed
customer_reviews.text: This has essentially sat little used for nearly 6 months. Just didn’t find time to dive in and learn what Alexa capabilities were. Finally got the time and was excited until it started rearing it’s limited abilities. The iPhone app is awful. For example, the Drop In feature was really exciting so I could chat with my children or eavesdrop while outside. However, it only connects about 1 out of 20 times. Another limited feature is asking basic questions like “what time does Dairy Queen in Bozeman open?” “Is REI open today?” She cannot answer. Is this because it’s the kids edition or are all Alexa’s like this? Regardless, I’m not impressed thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Brodie B.

customer_reviews.title: More engaging than a tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my child to help me with morning routines. As a bonus I thought she would have some fun playing her music or possibly asking silly questions from Alexa. The echo has done so much more. She plays games that have helped her with vocabulary words. With a daily weather report she feels empowered to make appropriate clothing choices in the morning. Clean the room reminders, fun facts, and of course easy access to kid appropriate stories and music have been great. She spends a little less time on the tablet and more playing games that take more imagination and creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Content filter
customer_reviews.text: Unable to change the content filter. We've tried resetting it back to factory settings and even deleting it but, the content filter is very extreme not allowing you as parents to be able to adjust the content filter.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy for the kids. No more yelling up the stairs just call them on the dot.
customer_reviews.text: Got the red one for my daughter and the blue for my son. There were some hiccups with setup but overall very easy and the kids love them. They can call us on our dot or our echo downstairs and they can call each other. I love that it keeps the content only suitable for their age as I deem fit. My daughter loves listening to the stories and my son loves dancing to the music. They both set their alarms now to wake up to disney music of their choice. I'll post updates if anything goes wrong or after extended use.
customer_reviews.author: texasT

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: I got this over the regular echo dot because if you factor in FreeTime it’s a good value. And I was planning to try FreeTe anyway. My kids love it and have a lot of fun with it. The setup is easy but maybe I it’s just me but I wish there’s a guide on what FreeTime includes. (What music, books, etc). I found this info on website but i was hoping the app would have this info. Or maybe I just haven’t found it yet? I still feel uneasy regarding privacy, but I need to do more research on this.
customer_reviews.author: AmznSh0ppr

customer_reviews.title: Wording is key
customer_reviews.text: Love that my 5 year old can use it. I’m not happy that you have to use very specific phrases in order to get what you want. Like if she wants a Disney story she has to ask for a bedtime story but not just a story. Also when she asked it to listen to “Ariel” (the little Mermaid) it started playing adult music. Also I don’t like that you can’t play music on two of them at the same time even though they are linked to different accounts!
customer_reviews.author: penelope6

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how I feel about it at this point.
customer_reviews.text: On day 3 of trying to get it set up an running. Had to down load two different apps for it an one wouldn't work with out a credit card being entered an it charged that card 30 something dollars an wasn't supposed to.. I didn't know you had to have prime for it to work right, I thought it just went off the wifi like Google.
customer_reviews.author: teia

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids, freetime subscription seems unnecessary
customer_reviews.text: Daughter (7) got it for her birthday and absolutely loves it. I appreciate all of the parental controls but the free time app/subscription seems like a nickel and dime way to get access to all of this content that honestly I have no idea how to get to my kids. The FreeTime app make the most sense for those with tablets, not sure how important it is for the Alexa device. Overall I think the device should have all of the parental features with or without the freetime subscription.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: But otherwise this is great and I like the parent dashboard with features that ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had to look up some tutorials on how to use it, but it was simple to set up. My 11 year old son loves listening to music. I've considered getting unlimited because between playing music on our tv through the firestick and his dot, they want to cancel each other out and we can't have both. But otherwise this is great and I like the parent dashboard with features that I can customize.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Understands my toddlers voice!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It understands my 3 year old! We have one in each room and she hates how they never understand her!! She is always asking to play songs but only her kids dot will pick up on what she actually wants and understand her speach! She wants the theme song from Elana of Avalor all the time.. and only the kids dot gets it right.. she loves putting on her own music like baby shark etc.. while playing in her room, and I love that it understands her and doesn’t play anything inappropriate by accident!
customer_reviews.author: amber27

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Google home
customer_reviews.text: Truly one of the worst products we've ever purchased from Amazon. Doesn't default to kids music and requires family music plan to stream music to them. I bought 2 and they literally are the most difficult and worthless pieces of technology. They want you to pay for free time for this, plus music subscriptions and none of it is easy to get to work on this. I own a regular echo dot and some google home products these are by far the worst save your money. If I could return them I would but they were Christmas gifts and it's to late.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Another waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on Black Friday and upon getting them going Christmas Day we found that they will not sync up with anything BUT amazon music. We bought these specifically to listen to music through pandor and iTunes and on all 3 that we purchased nothing works. This product is a joke and a scam. I have followed all directions on set up to the letter and have spent over an hour trying to get music to even play.
customer_reviews.author: Grooveymums

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect “kid friendly”
customer_reviews.text: I gave 1 star because while Alexa is cool, the kids version even with all the right programmed stuff still played a song all about murder and suicide. My young boys came to be traumatized and I was shocked by the lyrics of this kids approved song. I called Amazon and they never ever understood that this wasn’t a tech support issue. I had read previous reviews about inappropriate things but am not so helicoptering and didn’t think it would matter but it did. The issue remains unresolved and my kids and learned to tell Alexa to “skip” or “next song”. Stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Tali

customer_reviews.title: Setup and device
customer_reviews.text: One star for now , because at first you need a another device for Alexa, second , we not sure which app we should download , according the instruction we should download from the amazon.com , we did , light on Alexa is orange and it not showing up on setting of our iPad. Tried several time , and now I am late to work . It bday of my daughter, and she will wait for me all day till I setup it. You should notice people that Alexa for kids required some device to setup and that it will take a time. (((
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: bad customer service / frustrating experience
customer_reviews.text: I have reached out to customer service and have been unable to get resolution on connectivity issues with the echo's i've purchased. My assumption is that i set them up incorrectly as requests on one are satisfied on another. it's very frustrating and i'm considering returning them as they do not work the way i would expect. If someone can work with me to get these set up appropriately i will consider keeping and purchasing the monthly family music package. at this point when one is requested to read, the story is read on a separate echo device in another room. very frustrated considering the ease of setting up my original echo and the amount of usage it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice that it can't just read any book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter...but I am having a heck of a time getting to work right. It would be nice that it can't just read any book, it has to be in the aubi. library. The connection is very slow- from the initial time my daughter asks Alexa a request to the it's actually answered it's like be on dial up internet!!!!!! Additionally it would have be nice it instructions were given as to how get your 1 year free access. I don't know if I would buy another product like this again.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Molina-Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Useless when in free time
customer_reviews.text: Pretty frustrated and disappointed! I got this for 9 yr old for his birthday. Only to find out it won’t do what he wants. It won’t play ANY music that he asks for if it’s in free time mode. It will only play i heart radio. I even requested kids songs like old Macdonald and her response was can’t find it. Music was one of the main reasons I got it for my boys thinking they could enjoy good music but clean versions. When language filter is on and free time is not, it still plays explicit music. Will be sending our back.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer dixon

customer_reviews.title: Go with the Echo Dot, the kids version is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had went with the echo dots for my kids rooms and not the kid version. First off the speaker is terrible, it has to be at volume 9 or 10 to even hear it. It won't play full versions of songs that on are on my Amazon Prime Music account. It only plays samples. The only thing my kids like better about this version is the color. Otherwise for the money, go with the echo. It does the same thing as this does, only with better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these and I love that it helps them with their speech as well
customer_reviews.text: my kids each got one for xmas and we're all VERY happy with them. I'm comfortable letting them each have their own to ask and play however they want with alexa. We use them as intercoms throughout the house so I run around and yell less. My kids, ranging from age 2-10 realize they need to practice speaking louder, clearer and faster (at times) for alexa to understand. We're new to freetime and so far the kids love that as well on their fires so i say the price if you get a deal is worth it. I really like the neutral colors too.
customer_reviews.author: Minkypoo

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay connected to Wifi, which renders it useless.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of regretting this purchase. I can’t get it to stay connected to our home WiFi for the life of me, so my son can never use it. Anytime he tries it says, “I’m having trouble connecting to the internet; please refer to the help section on your Alexa app”. It has to stay plugged in to be utilized which is annoying, means any time you want to move it (for kids to listen during bath time, whatever) it has to reconnect to internet and all the b.s. I’m disappointed in this, in all honesty.
customer_reviews.author: Rainy Wallace

customer_reviews.title: I bought it thinking that my kids would enjoy it, but no that didn't happen
customer_reviews.text: It is really frustrating and not worth the money. Most of the time it won't be able to answer my kids questions. I think Alexa is still learning, and needs time to reach a satisfactory level. You always have to be very specific on what you want, or you will not get an answer. I also wants to point that when ever my kids ask Alexa for a bed time story, Alexa tells the story in a fast pace that the kids sometimes can't catch up with. I bought it thinking that my kids would enjoy it, but no that didn't happen. They enjoy Siri on my iPhone more and it is free.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Content is NOT screened properly, doesn't connect to App easily
customer_reviews.text: All the other editions worked perfectly. This kids edition couldn't automatically connect. I was on with Tech support for 20 minutes trying to figure it out before I gave up. It finally connected but it doesn't work seamlessly with the phone app. It doesn't play Amazon music but plays IHeart radio. The IHeart radio family station plays adult content songs about adult activities! My kids asked the KIDS EDITION to play the story of "The Three Little Pigs" and it played a very adult rated version about snuff, drinking and I turned it off before it got any further. My other Amazon devices will not "drop in" even though I set it up to.
customer_reviews.author: Freddiesafishie

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls work with existing Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: Already had an echo dot, I've just added the parental controls through my Freetime subscription. Love that I didn't need to buy a new device to get the primary features I was interested in. Still learning what I can do and finding there is more than expected - make sure you're familiar with parents.amazon.com as well as what's in the Alexa app / alexa.amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Roper

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yr old enjoys it. We use it every morning for his alarm. We don't use it much other then for playing music. He does get jokes from it, tells her goodnight, timers, check weather and some smart home stuff. I know we don't use it's full potential but does anyone actually use Alexa to her FULL benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Beta379

customer_reviews.title: What was the point with this???
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, sorry Amazon. You created a kids dot that does almost nothing the regular one can't already do. I thought I'd get: volume control ( like maximum volume for the kids), time scheduling, more remote control features (you know, because the kid has it). But actually I can't name anything this thing does differently. Oh yeah, it has a piece of foam wrapped around it. Should have put this one in the commercial. "We created a kids version that didn't really do anything!"
customer_reviews.author: M. Moscheck

customer_reviews.title: Alexa had trouble understanding voice commands
customer_reviews.text: My kid speaks and enunciates pretty well and Alexa never understood what was being asked. It even had trouble understanding me, which didn't make much sense. The whole reason we got it, was so the kids could ask her all their curious questions. I did like that the parents have access to every question that was asked to Alexa, as well as exactly what they were watching or listening to! But we had to return it because 90% of the time, she couldn't understand us which rendered the whole device pretty much useless. I hope they fix this because we love their Fire Sticks!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal D.

customer_reviews.title: HAVING TROUBLE CONNECTING TO THE INTERNET
customer_reviews.text: This ridiculous piece of plastic never, and I'll repeat, never works. Every single day my daughter (who we bought this for potty training) says "Alexa" and the little blue blobs response is "I'M HAVING TROUBLE CONNECTING TO THE INTERNET, TAKE A LOOK AT YOUR ALEXA APP" I checked the app, no there is nothing wrong with my internet (I checked several times). WE unplugged and re plugged it. turned off our router. This device worked a total of 10x and now doesn't work at all. Save your money and buy and a google home. They dont have any of these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sharry Dover

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you've heard about this device is probably true. It really does work as advertised, and the speech recognition is great. It even understands my three year old most of the time, but I bought this for my six year old, who adores it. One thing I wish were included would be some way to mount this on a wall. I'll figure something out, but it would be better if some kind of wall-mount dock were designed into it.
customer_reviews.author: William Ames

customer_reviews.title: lot's of fun
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift for my grandson he absolutely loves it and he loves playing games and listening to music from some of his favorite shows, listening to stories.....it is just great, he loves talking to Alexa on my echo and now that he has his own he is overjoyed....he loves 'Alexa tell me a joke' that i think is his favorite, then he will tell us the joke to answer ....it is just fun for him, and it is perfect for young children
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I like that it shields the kids a bit but it doesn’t allow them to listen to music at the same time. We would need to upgrade to Amazon music to have this ability. They argue over this. My kids are 8 and 11. I feel like I should have saved the money and just purchased the Echo 2nd gen for my 11 year old. Dropping in and announcements are now used often in our home. Love this capibility.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well..then speakers flaked out
customer_reviews.text: Had this Echo for just over a year and it's supposed to be covered under warranty for two but when I try to return it in the Amazon orders area, it's saying it's past the time of return. The sound coming out of speakers is fuzzy and distored. Have other echo's in the house without this issue but paid extra for kids version in hopes it would last longer. Amazon please fix the issue with return soonest as you are not reachable by phone!! Update: Amazon sent replacement unit and everything has been going smoothly with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Bilbruck

customer_reviews.title: Nice design and features geared toward kids.
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw the Kid's Edition I somewhat balked at the price. Ultimately, with the soft cover, the two year replacement and the included features I saw the value. Among other things, she uses it as an alarm, turns on her lamps with it, uses it for reference, reminders and games. After seeing the rest of the family having one she's happy to finally have one of her own.
customer_reviews.author: growworm

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Overall we are so pleased with our new family addition. The kids love finding new songs and playing some of the games. The only downside is the music database seems quite small. I'm hearing a lot of repeats on playlists and Alexa is unable to play a lot of requested music. We are struggling to link our apple music account to the Dot so until then we'll settle for what we have. Another upside: I love that we don't have to worry about Alexa playing something inappropriate for the kids' ears. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jilleroo

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this for my two-year-old son for Christmas and he is in love. He can barely say Alexa but the echo knows that he's talking to her. It is the greatest thing for kids. It will tell you jokes , bedtime stories, read you books, sings you songs. And you can also customize the voice so it's not the original lady talking, like for instance my son's is SpongeBob and Patrick. Highly suggest buying these for any age kid.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Has nice features, but needs work
customer_reviews.text: Alexa has some nice features, but it needs work. We linked Pandora and could never get it to work. Several reviews told me that apparently it's a common issue. We added prime music unlimited and havent had an issue. You have to play with wording for awhile to figure out what you need to say to get to what you want. Some of the skills are neat. We tried playing the games but alexa has a hard time picking up the kids voices (for example my 7 year old responds and they don't give enough time for the response and it repeats the questions) which is frustrating since this is marketed for children.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfFourGirls

customer_reviews.title: No real 'kids' difference
customer_reviews.text: I think if this one had the ability like my echos to relocate around the house, or be taken off the charger to go wherever I would be much more impressed. I had ordered it for my daughter to get her to stop bringing my echo outside to listen to music as she swings and instead ended up with a wall bound dot that has a protective cover. The year of skills for kids hasn't interested her in the least because she would rather google most of the answers. All in all there's no real difference between this and any other dot.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great concept, just not sure it’s there yet
customer_reviews.text: The stories seem limited and are often repeated when my son asks for a story. They are also extremely short. Disney Stories seem to work well though. My son is also fairly articulate, git I’d say the dot responds accurately only about 50% of the time. The kids dot should be adjusted to be a bit more lax when listening to kids talk vs adults as sometimes it’ll take a kid longer to speak a full thought. More instruction from Alexa when asking a question would be helpful too, as most of the time it tells my son to have an adult help. It’s a great concept, just not sure it’s there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Goodman

customer_reviews.title: I really like the original echo but was concerned about my kids ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the original echo but was concerned about my kids access to adult content on the devices. I was excited when I heard they were finally providing a kids edition. Unfortunately the software is not ready at release. The software does not recognize linking accounts both freetime or other accounts such as pandora. Rebooting or resetting does not fix the issues. Very frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Robert B .Worley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my son's speech
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my son who is working on his speech. He has been working on it for sometime. We hoped this would help him working on his letter pronunciation and it has. The only word of caution, is this working on wifi, so you need to understand the limits of the wifi you are utilizing. We had to change where we were going to use it at because of that. That is our home wifi issue and not a problem with the echo.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya M.

customer_reviews.title: DEVICE WORKS FINE, THE SOFTWARE DOWNLOAD IS TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Echo Dots in 2017. They worked fine. I changed my internet provider to HughesNet and needed to reload the apps. I went to Amazon.com and found the Alexa app. When I tried to download it I was advised that I needed another app. and should go to the Amazon store to get it. No mention of which app. I needed. There are a bazillion apps in the Amazon store, of that there are numerous "Alexa apps. Nothing to provide guidance. Bah !!
customer_reviews.author: Skyrider

customer_reviews.title: Great product but....
customer_reviews.text: I love everything Alexa. I think it is great to have a smart home. Makes my life easier. Now, lets get to the part I do not like. I do not like that the freetime does not allow for the setting of our security system. Our children know how to operate Alexa with our security system. They arm it and disarm it. They should be able to do the same when freetime is enabled. Maybe we are not using it correctly somehow I am not sure. But in the time of need, the children may need to arm or disarm the security system and cannot when the freetime function is enabled.
customer_reviews.author: Lock

customer_reviews.title: Ease of setting up and functionality
customer_reviews.text: The best device ever!! Arrived quickly (regardless of opting for the no-rush option and receiving a credit-BONUS!!). My 6 year old grandson LOVES it! He can now ask Alexa all those difficult questions about dinosaurs, weather, sea life, and Sasquatch. His mother loves it and uses it to play her favorite songs while she’s getting ready for work. It was super easy to set up as well. I WILL be purchasing the adult version for my own home. Thank you Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Alice M. Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I am having so much fun with our new dot. I use it to control my fire stick, play music, read my audible books, and keep me up to date with the news. My son enjoys listening to books, hearing jokes, asking questions, and playing games. I purchased the kid's edition because I wanted it to be easy for my little one to use, but I had some problems with it adding skills. Fortunately, customer service had me disconnect freetime which fixed the problem. I just think it's weird that both Alexa and freetime are designed to work together, but it doesn't work out well.
customer_reviews.author: Darling Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but then eventually stops talking
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this for a year now. I have been resetting, restarting, over and over trying to figure a way to get it to work again. It was great, untill it stopped talking back. I even tried connecting it to a bluetooth speaker after resetting it to see if it would work that way. No luck. I have been battling this for the past few months. It connects fine to my app, works to turn off and on my other wifi products, but talking and playing music or books for my kids is not an option anymore...
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Just don’t.
customer_reviews.text: Just buy the regular Echo Dot. I have tried to like this for over a month. We got a regular dot and a kids dot for Christmas, but we can only get the regular dot to add skills. My daughter doesn’t interact with her dot because it never does what she asks. Just buy the regular dot. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Y

customer_reviews.title: Teaches inquiring little minds. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my granddaughter. She loves this! She asks tons of questions and it's teaching her so much! She is 9 and heard about the Titanic in school, came home asked questions about it and learned all about it and it's sister ships. And knew the name of a woman who worked on all 3 ships and survived them all. IAM amazed by all she learns. Oh and she can call Gigi any time. I guess I love it too!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Smart home capabilities are disabled !!
customer_reviews.text: Will change my review to 5 stars when smart home capabilities are added. That’s the whole reason I bought the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bates

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you research if you want to use these as multi-room speakers.
customer_reviews.text: So far it works perfectly and does what we want. Don't expect to not have a war if you don't have the family music plan and more than one kid. You can only play music one at a time on each unit if you don't have the more robust family music from Amazon or several services separate to play different music. I find the function we use the most is the drop in though. Makes not yelling up our three flights of stairs much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Larinis

customer_reviews.title: Not all apps work
customer_reviews.text: Giving this one star because it does not connect to Apple Music even though it’s supposed to. Tried several different tactics to fix it but nothing work. And when googling the problem I discovered many others are having the same problem and there’s no fix in sight. The only way for kids to play a song they pick is if I also purchase amazon music. So just stuck using it on pandora and getting random songs. I tried to contact amazon about the issue in hopes they could fix the Apple Music app but got no response. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good.
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s been good. Sometimes it has hard time hearing me though. Even when I loudly say wake up word. My kids love kids music on it. My almost 5 yo can verbally ask Alexa for things but half of the time it will mess up. But it’s understandable considering his pronunciation isn’t perfect. What I like about Alexa in general is that it understandands simple worded commands. Like if my child wants to play a song again he says “ Alexa, play backwards” and it gets him every single time :) and plays that song over again. We’ve had it for few days as so far we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Let Down
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with this. We already had an Echo and a Dot in the house and decided to purchase one for the twins' bedroom for the "Parental control and Free Time". Alexa has never been the brightest, but now she's an expensive apologetic blinking hockey puck. Seriously. Ask her to open Audible and read a story...you must know the name of a book on an unknown list. Perhaps she could make a suggestion since we have no clue what our choices are??? Trying to find answers sends your in endless circles. I love Amazon, but I am very disappointed in this purchase. I hope updates will improve it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Topolewski

customer_reviews.title: WE. LOVE. THIS.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 8th Birthday. He absolutely loves it!! He sets his own alarm, so no more fighting to wake up in the morning. It reads bedtime stories and plays music, so no more TV at bedtime on school nights. It helps him with his spelling words and math. You can ask Alexa anything and he listens to his music all the time. I was worried that Alexa would have a hard time understanding him, but so far no issues! I'm still trying to figure out how he can "call" me from it. But otherwise GREAT GIFT!
customer_reviews.author: Nope Nope

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE! Do NOT buy if your child wants to listen to Music or Audible Books
customer_reviews.text: If your child, like mine, would like to listen to music (or books from Audible) from their Amazon Music playlist...THAT WAS PURCHASED, do not buy the echo dot for kids, you cannot access the music. What's even more ridiculous is you can make the music play on the device, but only by going to the alexa.amazon.com site and selecting the music...um? not really the point of a voice activated device????? Please note, this is not an issue with the voice command request, because the same music library can be access from my other alexa devices with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Root

customer_reviews.title: Sound machine keeps shutting off - primary reason for purchase
customer_reviews.text: We have an echo dot we use in our master bedroom for sound machine purposes to sleep. We bought this kid's version for the same reason, and to use the additional music features for our toddler. But the sound machine will NOT stay on all night, regardless of the loop feature being turned on, and that is incredibly frustrating. We will be returning it. What is the point of a sound machine that won't stay on all night without you having to wake up every hour and tell it to start again? The kids version should be no different than the regular with these kinds of settings.
customer_reviews.author: Robert and Lauren

customer_reviews.title: My son LOVES it and so do we!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get your kids to listen to good information and grow their knowledge. My 5 year old son listens to Disney stories all the time and loves the "Joke" feature. I love the "drop in" feature where I can speak to him through the echo via my phone app and listen to what he is doing!
customer_reviews.author: Mariela Laluz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: MY 2 Boys so Love this thing and so do I! I mean it plays their music for them, wakes them up in the morning for school, reads them books including at night, even helps with their homework. I also really love how through the app I have on my tablet I can drop in on them and tell them things like “Come down for dinner”. I would certainly recommend this for anyone looking for a really great present for a child. FYI My 2 Boys are 6 & 7yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great unit. Sound quality lacks.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 3rd gen dots and 2 2nd gen echos. I bought the kids edition for my two youngest. I should have just bought 2 more 3rd gens. The sound quality is subpar to say the least. And to charge double the price should be a sin. I get that free time is included, but if I had to do it over again I would have went with the newer model. Otherwise works just as intended. Kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: BrianK

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I just couldn’t use it.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great at my house but unfortunately, wouldn’t work at my school. Something about the WAP enterprise and because our school isn’t set to personal. Not sure what all that means but our technology person spent a lot of time trying to get it to connect and it wouldn’t work. Really disappointed because it works in other schools and worked at home. He said it was on Amazon’s end about why it wouldn’t connecting to our enterprise. I don’t have a use for it at home so I had to return it. I do think it would be a good addition for a home with children.
customer_reviews.author: Katie0010

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: We brought Alexa to our whole house for Christmas- all 3 kiddos have one in their room, and the main living areas have them. We are just beginning to know the features and it is so much fun. I had resisted this much technology in the home, but I got tired of spelling 50+ words a day for my son, and decided to just embrace it. I’m surprised how much I love them having it.
customer_reviews.author: Handsome Jack

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My son is 6 and loves this. I downloaded some stories on audible and while e is playing he will ask Alexa to read him the stories or play music. I like that with the Alexa app it documents the questions he asks . This also can call my cellphone if needed. I like how you can have an alarm or timer. So Alexa will play music during the morning alarm for 15 minutes and then you can also set a timer. I also like the announcement that you can send to all the devices . You can say something like, don’t forget to rush your teeth before you come downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: rosa santa cruz

customer_reviews.title: Does not stream different music from multiple dots at same time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of the kids echo dots for my kids as a gift. We got them all set up in their rooms so the could each individually use. Unfortunately, I didn’t realize before purchasing that you can’t stream different music to different dots at the same time. So now they all fight over who’s turn it is to stream music. Would never purchase if you are looking to stream different music into different areas at same time!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Spink

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My kids love their new dots. They each have one and love to listen to books. With the year of FreeTime they will have plenty to listen to. It catches their voice and plays plenty loud. Alexa has tons of apps now on her, most are kid friendly. They love to listen to books, have her play music, or just talk to it often. I love that I can use it to make announcements, wake them or call them when I want, adn control when it can be used.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Regalado

product_meta.title: Echo Dot Kids Edition, a smart speaker with Alexa for kids - blue case
feature_bullets: Now Alexa is a kid-friendly DJ, comedian, and storyteller — and she’s always getting smarter. Just ask and Alexa will play music, answer questions, read stories, tell jokes, and more — all with younger ears in mind.
Up to $109 in savings on Echo Dot (Black), 1 year of Amazon FreeTime Unlimited, and a kid-friendly case, plus a 2-year worry-free guarantee—if they break it, return it and we’ll replace it for free

The included 1 year of FreeTime Unlimited gives your kids access to thousands of hours of fun and educational content, including ad-free radio stations and playlists, Audible books, and a growing list of premium kids skills. After one year, your subscription will automatically renew every month starting at just $2.99/month plus applicable tax. You may cancel any time by visiting the Amazon Parent Dashboard or contacting Customer Service.

1 year of FreeTime Unlimited gives you access to over 1000 Audible books for kids, like Beauty & the Beast and Peter Pan, thousands of songs, and kid-favorite games and skills from Disney, National Geographic, Nickelodeon, and more
Easy-to-use parental controls in the online Amazon Parent Dashboard let you set daily time limits, review activity, or pause Alexa on the device
Kids can control lights, plugs, switches, and more with compatible connected devices
Automatically filter explicit songs from Amazon Music, Apple Music, or Spotify
Call kids to dinner or tell them it’s bedtime from compatible Echo devices in the house. Plus, add approved friends and family for calling and messaging outside the house.
Echo Dot Kids Edition is not a toy.
